reviews.review_msg: COGS 100 Professor Begby is an overall great guy. He values true learning. He is definitely one of the best professors at SFU. He genuinely cares about students and is always accessible. He also gives good feedback so that you can improve. He is very friendly, helpful, and approachable, and seems to genuinely enjoy teaching. 10/10 recommend.

One of the best profs ever! Even though phil 120 is a writing course, his papers are short, and actually interesting to write about. the final was great, as long as you attended lectures and had the general idea of what each philosopher had to say, you're golden. Possible GPA booster, and I'm not even good at writing.
He is funny and kind in a very genuine way.
This professor is amazing!! He is very kind, takes his time to answer questions and is very enthusiastic. Take his class if you want good education.

Really boring class. He also doesn't accurately present author's views. In one case he claimed the paper was arguing for legal restrictions, when she clearly states it is a moral argument and doesn't in any way imply anything about the law.

Sam is a fantastic lecturer!  He really communicates clearly and makes sure the class understands the main concepts.  The content of the course is very interesting, although readings are hard to plow through.  Just go to lectures, listen, and study from the slides.   The course, especially papers, requires a lot of thinking, but not unreasonable.

Lectures show some main points well, but arguing how persuasive they are just makes me toss the paper and book into the air like whatever, as it could go like whatever. No meaningful feedback from TA for a direction to write a sensical paper, and already the fragmented ideas are hard enough to put together. Just confusing each other back and forth.
I loved Dr. Black, it was very easy to follow his lectures, and was lots of fun

obviously he tried hard to make the course interesting. was it? no. i was on msn during class all the time and attended ..really for no reason. but i still did super well, i guess because i'm good at writing essays and memorizing dumb things.

He sincerely tried to help students understand. He gave nice examples to help remember concepts, like "whether a 'sympathizer' would help someone who was hanging from a tree with his limbs cut off, and had boiling hot water poured on him by relieving his pain and killing him." -Sam Black. If you didn't like Phil120, blame the subject, not the prof.

The course content was okay, but lectures were so boring! He has a droning voice that tends to put people to sleep. If you plan to attend lecture, be sure to have something to record it so you can refer back to it later on. If you're a business student looking to get the writing requirement, DON'T take this class - it's a waste of your time.
He had an almost monotone voice, and i could just understand of pay attention to anything he said.

Moral philosophy is a waste of time. This course is good if you like to hone your skills at arguing endlessly and aimlessly. Black, although seemingly passionate, is a bland prof whom if you're doing worse than a B+, is completely unhelpful. Both TA and prof were completely useless at helping me grasp the material. Stay far far away.

He is an amazing prof. despite this is a writing intensive course he makes it not so bad. He def. knows what he is talking about and his lectures are super helpful is explaining the readings. If you are lazy good luck, this is a class you don't want to slack in:p
A dry teacher where it is hard to even stay awake in class. The entire class consists of writing 3 essays and attending tutorials. Be prepared for hard marking on the essays.

Sam Black was hard to understand.  The reading material was long and hard to digest.  So, writing the 3 papers were hell.  My TA didn't help that much, but did try to make things a bit clearer.  I think that the TA will make a difference in this course. The final was fairly okay though, considering that I didn't finish any of my readings.

Ok. Final exam was easy-if it was compared to those essays.  For the essay topics, you have to read for abt 10 times before you understood what the question was.  Also, TA wasn't great at helping us improve our essays.  Lectures were BORING and TA didn't know how to teach.  Had to figure everything out myself.  Textbook makes things harder.
He's nice.He's friendly.find the information okay to digest...but he assumes that you know the stuff which is pretty daunting if it's your first year.it's only my 5th week .

u either kno it or u dun't.  i didn't really get it, but enough to pass!  he makes some errors in the lecture notes.  u hand in 10 weekly reflections & 3 papers (writing intensive) [i recommend not doing it last minute ><] .  Final i guess was fairly easy .. but hey, phil is not for me!

Pretty good class, prof. If you're not big into philosophy, it can get kinda boring. He's good at trying to make lectures interesting, and he tries to make sure everyone understands the material. Overall, I'd reccomend this class to anyone seeking an intro phil course. Beware though, it's writing intensive...but the finals fairly easy.

Don't expect to get an A since only 7% of the class is allowed to get it. As long as you attend every lecture, you should do well in the final. Kind of boring class. Weekly reflections can get kind of annoying since the material is boring and therefore there's not much to reflect upon.
No Comments
If you end up in this slot it's not very demanding.  Lectures appear uninspired and not engaging;  so much for a 120 course.
The Final Exam was pretty easy, lectures get a little boring at times, but he's overall a pretty good prof.

Good prof for a first year class. Definetly very clear and made complex philosophy seem very easy. I personally think he over simplified stuff a bit too much but for a first year philosophy course it was appropriate.
His lectures and notes were full of errors (downright contradictions of the texts, and obvious misinterpretations).
No Comments
funny guy,, knows his stuff, and enjoys it
BRUTAL!!  Hard class and horribly boring.  Almost impossible to get a good mark, especially since the content was so dull!!

Awesome course....helpful notes...teaching was very effective. Great attitude in and out of the class. Enjoyed the lectures even thought i often fell asleep in them, but the lecture tapes were very helpful.....prepared me real good for the exam.
TOUGH curving system: out of 100 stuents, only 10 As, 10-15 Bs, and the rest are all Cs.
BORING! BORING! BORING! DOES HE KNOW HOW TO USE AN OVERHEAD TO WRITE SOME NOTES DOWN?
an informative and interesting course. Sam's got a great teaching skills and passion for philosophy.
Easy to Understand, comprehensive notes
Can't answer student questions, unclear, BORING, BORING, BORING.
No Comments
I was tired in the afternoon course wish it was teh morning
extremely interesting course, and i enjoyed every minute of it!!
ok lectures, good notes, learning a lot and loving philosophy!
Tough to pay attention to.

Bill is an awesome prof!! Highly recommend for any first year students!! It is an easy W course and he will do anything to help you succeed! The concepts are easy, just make sure you fully understand them! You will never get an A+, but he does give out alot of good grades!

Ohmygod...this guy is hilarious...rambles a LOT during lecture and comes up with kooky examples but that's exactly what makes it so fun. Leave your notebooks at home now and then and just LISTEN - you'll have lots of laughs and still learn plenty. Love the deep, booming voice too!
he acts and tries to give off the I'm a chill teacher vibe but he's actually kinda strict. the course is easy but the concepts are confusing and he doesnt simplify the way he teaches the material.

This is for Phil 105. Very fair course. Lyle is a good lecturer and course content is interesting. Read his textbook! All the information you need to do well is in it! Also, the practice exams in it are of the same format as the ones he will ask you on exams :). Good elective especially for STEM folks who are looking for a MACM-esque course. 5/5.

This is just a simplified MACM101 class with glorified vocab for the art students to feel smart. He grades heavily on things that are not important such as participation (with iClicker) and pointless tutorials. Doesn't matter if you understand the concepts because the entire class is just about "showing up".

Lyle is a great guy. This is a very FAIR course, some concepts are challenging but if you read the manual and reach out for help when you're stuck, you'll do well. The most important and helpful tip I have is to do the practice exams at the end of each unit (answers provided). The structure of exams are based on these!
Doesn't even give answers to practice questions; so theres no point in doing them
Very handsome instructor! I think all girls would like to take his class. Very attractive teaching style! I will take another class from him. If you want to learn something, go and take his class.

Prof. Warriner's lectures were well paced and she definitely enjoyed teaching the class. The class itself was very interesting in terms of the topics we covered. There were readings that definitely help you understand the material better, but not necessary to do well in the class. Show up to class, study the lecture slides, and you'll be fine.

Extremely well-paced and thorough lecturer - her slides are clear and she speaks about complicated issues in an accessible way. Charming sense of humour and reasonably difficult standards in exams. There is a lot of reading to do for the class, but her slides cover all of the materials on the tests, so readings are only necessary for writing papers
Best phil prof at SFU. extremely helpful, makes everything you need to know very clear, and makes the subject interesting.

My fellow students, if you are looking for a life-time mentor, seeking for a professor who might strengthen your critical thinking process, don't miss the opportunity to take one of Dr. Warriner's courses. You will not regret your choice forever!
Great professor. She is very friendly and kind professor. I went to see her today, she even offers me help whenever I needed. A big thank to her.

good prof! midterm is fair but the average is low. Final is lengthy..Low stake assignments do not require a lot of efforts. the only problem is that she does not share her notes. Take a laptop to the class. Notes is extremly important for doing well in the exams. BTW tutorial can be boring. Prof hold some of the tut as well.

Mid-term was quite easy...however the final was much harder.  Most of the material she says is based from her notes but the final didn't seem that way.  Overall she is a good teacher though, very nice, very helpful.
Awesome
Makes philosophy relevant.
Great course, good lectures, but it's definitely not easy...
This prof has turned me off from ever taking another philosophy class.

This was one of the worst classes I have taken so far at SFU. I had high hopes going into this class but that quickly faded. The prof was unorganized and unclear in terms of the material that she covered.  She was a very difficult marker. I would NOT recommend this class to anyone!

tried to go for help, only had one day of office hours, considering all of the classes she teaches one would think she would have more, she's nice though however I do not recommend this course to be taken for a first year's first semester.

She is one of my favourite profs at SFU.  I always saw her for my papers and she gave lots of suggestions.  If you see her for your papers, you should do fine.  Also do the study guide she gives you since everything except for the essay is taken from there.  Don't re-read the textbook, just do the study guide and you'll be fine!!!

This is my second philosophy course that I took and let me say that she's an awesome prof.  I saw her for all of my papers and she was very helpful every single time.  If she gives out a study guide, DO IT.  The questions from the exams come from there.  There isn't a lot of guessing.
boring lectures
The TAs are super stingy with marking. The course itself is very subjective, so the TAs assign grades subjectively based on their personal beliefs.

Sam is a very good prof. The weekly readings can be a long and confusing sometimes, but the lectures are very good at summing it up. For the papers GO TO OFFICE HOURS they help a lot and will get you to know your TA better. Also, let the TA know what you're writing about because you don't want to write a paper have have the TA say it sucks after.

Sam is an excellent professor. Very accommodating and easily approachable, and he's always quick to respond to emails in my experience. His slides sum up the readings extremely well, and there are study guides available for each topic/philosopher covered in class. If you enjoy writing and are into philosophy, it's a great course.

Hes so funny, even if you dont like philosophy you can sit through these lectures and find them interesting. He's so expressive and effortlessly just a good prof. Genuinely so sweet and makes it easy to do well in his class!!

Had every resource available for his students to do well and it was GREAT. Also something i loved: he does NOT give more than 20 pages of reading per week, and often gave less than 10. He really makes an effort to understand his students and will help you do well in his class in literally any way he can. Best prof, 100% recommend.

Sam is honeslty such a cutie, he cares a lot about his students AND about philosophy. His class turned me onto philosophy and was easy but interesting!! You learnt a lot and did well at the same time. LOVE SAM, take this class

Good prof and class for Phil. The main components of ur grade come from the 3 essays so if you have a good TA you're blessed. Interesting Lecs that have easy participation quizzes. Overall good experience.

Honestly, pretty cool guy, you do have to read since it is Philospohy but he makes it really interesting and the content was pretty intersting as well. would 100% take this class again if there were no tutorials.

Overall Sam is a very great prof! he makes lecture fun however, sometimes it could get a bit boring. One thing to be aware he has in class quizzes but they're pass or fail all you need to do is do the quiz! Overall would recommend if you need an easy phil class :)
This Proff is very enthusiastic about philosophy and loves to answer questions. The lectures can boring but still gives good information.

I like him as a prof, lectures are long but he is very passionate about the topics. There is only one final and I've heard it's on the more difficult side just because it's the only one. Other than that grading on essay's were fair.
Sam is a very tough grader

Sam helps translate philosophy to help us understand what is being said from old text. He also likes to use examples where you put yourself in the position to make hypothetical decisions which helped me grasp the concepts better and enhanced my critical thinking. I just wished he used more things to help keep students engaged during lectures.

Prof Black is such a caring guy really wants to make people feel welcomed. His slides are a handful and the readings are advanced but if you gi ti his office hours and are eager to learn about it youll have no issue. Nicest professor.
Great professor and pretty easy to be honest.
She gave out lots of readings but I do not suggest doing them. Her entire lecture are just going over the readings so there is no point in actually doing the readings yourself. Easy class though.
Guindon is a cool guy but he seems to be a bit of a strict marker. Pray you get a good TA because they will help solidify the concepts which Guindon can be a bit verbose about in lectures

Nice guy. Exams had a take-home portion, and we were required drafts for papers which was a lifesaver. Lectures complimented readings well, but he just read off slides. It's possible to get a B without attending lectures and just reading slides/papers. The exam was reasonable, try to understand the readings each week to avoid cramming.

Very good prof and passionate about what he is teaching. Try your best to keep up with the readings or you will have to catch up all semester for the final exam. Depending on your TA will determine if you get an easy or hard marker for papers. Content-wise it was harder than the description described but mentioned many interesting topics.
Wonderful Professor! Very interesting lectures and very interesting guy.

David made his effort to explain the materials and tried to let us think some moral issues. This course is not hard at all..although some people say there's an essay. But the answer for the essay topics was on his notes! If you read through his notes, you'd not get any problems writing the essay because the notes tell you what you need to respond.
Very good prof! Responsible, interesting, and fair. Highly recommend him!
Highly recommend Dr. Zimmerman! Very good lectures, NOT boring at all. Interesting course material, and a very responsible professor. Will definitely be taking more courses with him in the future.
No Comments
Not the greatest prof ive ever had. His lectures are interesting but confusing. Knowledge gained in course was minimcal and not useful at all. Very nice guy, moderate prof.

this course is not too bad when you take it with him. he's a very approachable prof when you need questions answered. the class itself is boring but the content is quite straight forward and easy! it's an easy A!

Very monotonous voice, I fell asleep at least once per class.  Both midterm and final gave not enough time to finish for the amount of questions.  He's a bit of an airhead, as the class and TAs were always correcting him.  The only good thing about him is he can moonwalk.

Lec are fairly interesting, though sometimes it is hard not to fall asleep. his notes are crap, typos all over and he admits to typing them up the hour b4 class. midterms and final are long, and though the questiosn are fair, i didnt do too well on them. enjoyable if you can write well.

omg... this guy is super super hard and cunfuzzling. messes up with his notes every single time. it seems like he writes his notes just before the classes start or sumthin. always always has a mistake. midterms were easy but finals were killer. really needs to get rid of his monotonous speech... zZz

i agree, staying awake in that class takes quite a bit of effort. his notes are crappy and his lectures consists simply of reading the notes outloud, but with a bit of elaboration that sometimes (but n ot always) help with understanding the material.

The class is a bore.  I fall asleep at the half way point every class.  He can crack some jokes once in a while but I didn't find myself understanding ahything unless I look back at some notes.  He also doesn't not know how to put notes up online properly.
i tried staying awake. i tried. my friend once woke me up 5 times in one lecture, but i kept falling asleep. and i had plenty of sleep on the night before that day.
Very interesting lectures, and a great sense of humour! I can't wait to take more classes with Dr. Zimmerman.
The most insecure man I've ever met.  Seems like he would be the nicest person ever, but sorry the guy cannot teach.  Stutters and really isn't sure what he's talking about.  But hey...he's nice?

no i'm not exaggerating. His lectures are very boring. I go to lectures everytime, and not have a clue what he is talking about. I'm NOT implying he is a bad prof, but boring only. The course is kinda hard too, unless U R one of those COMPLEX THINKER WRITERS.
oh man! this prof is so boring he sounds so monotone when he speaks, it's like he's reading off a book.  i would not recommend him at all! although the course was relatively easy.
I love him! His class is fantastic, he has a great sense of humour and he's both approachable and engaging. Take this class if you're interested in philosophy.
Delivers material effectively. Uses engaging methods of teaching. Recommend both the prof and the class.
His lectures are boring and you can see people falling asleep in his class.
Class was easy but hell to sit through . This guys a total nut job.
Very respectable teacher, cares about students, and masters course material; an overall great teacher. Definately take any course with him.
No Comments
No Comments
No Comments
He's great- funny, warm, compassionate, likes students
EXCELLENT! funny, & warm!...Dolores
A+
Walked out in lecture once cause he had unkown issues.
No Comments

I had to take a PHIL class as a requirement and I'm so glad I took this one. Dr. Tiffany was one of the only reasons I could understand philosophy (TA Chrys was also amazing). fantastic sideshow art made readings easy to grasp and he went over difficult questions in weekly quizzes. Questions would even be omitted if many people didn't understand

Professor Tiffany is a great guy himself, and very invested in his lecture and ability to explain the content. For a 100 course, it seems more difficult than a lot of 200 classes homework, writing and reading-wise. The TAs grade HARD, and don't give good reasons for the marks you've received. Very harsh for a first year course.

Evan is an AMAZING professor. Admittedly, I developed a little bit of a crush on him  within 3 seconds of his first lecture but it kept me focused and coming to class. He explains everything with such clarity and available for extra help too. His lectures are never dry. Evan, you da best! We had 3 papers I think, midterm (easy!) and a final

Really good prof, lots of readings, but if you don't do them all it's not the end of the world as her clearly explains everything during lecture.  Minimal amount of writing, and as long as you studied the tests are fairly easy.  Pretty good class, I took it as a w requirement and it was a really good decision.

my first sem at sfu, and I'm glad I have a class with Dr Tiffany. This is the only class I don't dread going to. He makes you think critically and encourages students to voice their own opinions. don't procrastinate on your papers!

Dr T was a nice guy. He highly encourages participation and often the 50 min class goes by too fast. very thought provoking class, heavy on the theory so know your kant/utilitarianism. didn't think i'd like the class at first, but I had an amazing TA, and ended with an A+. you need to really know how to write a good phil paper though. exams all MC
Definitely would take a class with him again.  His lectures are well prepared and he encourages participation.  Interesting and funny.

He wrote his own textbook which was really really easy to understand (and save us some money too!) His voice is really passive so the lecture's kinda boring but the content itself is really interesting. Overall, I give it a "B"
He's giving pretty boring lectures and you need to be really focus and interested in Philosophy in order to feel he's a good prof.
why i am now majoring in phil.
an excellent teacher. prepares his lecture with uttmost care and work.
Really hard course. Philosophy is useless along with Tiffany, hard content, bad exam prep and I had a useless TA

Lectures are boring. Content is NOT ENGAGING and he makes things more complicated than it needs to be. The course itself is fairly difficult, and this prof is no help to you if you're lost or confused. Word of advice: even if Tiffany isn't your prof, don't take this course. But my point is he's a boring and useless prof.

Wow...this class was HARD.  But that is probably because it was my first time taking a philosophy course.  Good luck.  Read read read and GO TO HIS OFFICE HOURS.  He gives you hints for the exams and papers lol.  Like so much help with them I'm not even kidding.  Oh and he likes to show lots of movie clips during lectures.  It was fun too.

A sharp thinker who prepares you well for exams. His style of lecturing can make the concepts seem convoluted, but listening to the tapes while studying was actually helpful. I also had an awesome TA who explained the material perfectly, so overall it was a fun course to take. Recommended for people who enjoy ethical debates and logical thinking.

Not the easiest prof, but definitely one of greatest profs I have ever had at SFU. Fun lectures, fair marks for paper. He actually gives yo study guide which covers almost everything in MD and Final. You have options for essay questions, could choose ones u r most confident with. Also good to have a responsible TA.

He seems to have a good personality. He cares about students in some ways. Drawback is that he talks in a way it is confusing sometimes, although the material itself is a bit trick, still TA will help you on this. The exams are fair as long as you cover the review sheet throughly.
he's a nice guy but he just cant teach. the course itself itsnt that great, but he makes it really dry. he takes a point and goes in circles instead of being straightforward.

Obviously, one disgruntled student got online on Feb. 26th and tried to trash Dr. Tiffany.  I have taken alot of his courses.  He's great.  Don't pay attention to the 5 previous posts.  Interesting, entertaining...fun.
this guy is not funni at all he thinks he is and his monotone voice just makes him even more boring. Also movies he shows us is totally random, do not reccomend

I do not recommend his class. His notes are unorganized and confusing. His handwriting is uncomprehensible and cluttered, often big words that you cant even figure out what the relation is to the relevant topic. He speaks in monotone and his lectures are a snorefest. He knows his stuff but he is really bad at TEACHING it. Stay away if you can.

Dr. Proffesor Tiffany I hope you read this: YOU ARE A SOFT TALKER. SPEAK UP PLEASE! It does not help that you speak so eloquently that you lose most of the class who is trying to learn these convoluting concepts. Half the class is just trying to stay awake at 1:20 in the afternoon. Furthermore you frighten the **** out of us with your exams.

Boring lectures, boring tutorials...sigh. Phil 120 with this guy = death unless you're good at unraveling his contradicting words in his monotone voice. Stay away from him if you dont want to get killed. Hes not even good looking like the ratings imply...

Lousy prof, his lectures were very vague and boring. Dosesnt help if most of the class is in 3rd and 4th year because its on a stupid curve... this is supposed to be a first year course. Also doesnt help if you have a**** TA
Total cutie. (And a great prof too :).

Dr.Tiffany's class is good times. His explanations are clear and interesting and he leads good discussion, even in lecture. Shows a lot of movie clips, makes the information relevant. NINE papers though- 6 short, 3 long, which has been a ****, although again, the subject matter is good.

This guy is lame. He picks two points and beats them for an hour. He talks in a slow monotone. What content is there gets lost pretty easily in the boredom of the lecture. I hear he's better in seminar, but in a large lecture, he's pretty ineffective.
He's a really nice, funny guy who knows how to keep his students paying attention and interesting. He goes over all the information and posts his notes. Overall, he's a great professor.

Not a big fan of this guy... totally monotone and pauses for a breath between each and every word.. I've been in his class for over a month, and even with 2 lectures/week we still haven't moved past the concept we started the course with..     ...and... I don't think these raters have ever really looked at him...
Evan Tiff is freakin hot. Plus he's a great teacher, I'm not a fan of philosophy but I loved this class. Yeah, you have to keep up with the readings, but thats like any university class...

I would have liked the class better if the readings were the original philosophy texts like in some other phil courses.  Instead, he used articles written by other people about Socrates' thought, etc.  Made it less detailed and more difficult to understand the concepts precisely.

I think he's a pretty hot prof, haha. He's fun to watch, lots of movie and tv show clips during lecture. The essays aren't easy though, going to lecture is not enough to do well in this course.  You have to do ALL of the assigned reading, and its good to get your TA to help clarify things.  With philosophy it's easy to miss the point.

An OK prof. He likes to engage the class in discussion during lectures. Good for involvement/questions, but lectures sometimes got a bit off track cuz of so much discussion. Makes you do peer-reviews of your papers and some little writing exercises that seemed like busy-work.
The worst course ever.
No Comments

Minimum amount of reading. If you pay attention in class and really use your brain then I don't think any reading is required. Very awesome class that gets you thinking, unless you plan to just sit and sleep in class.
Boo! Makes ethical philosophy dettached from the real world. Studying realistic delimma's would be more valuble in an introductory course. BOOOurns! SOOOOOOOO NOT Impressed!!!

this course is a GPA booster! Not so tough that you'll struggle to keep up rather than learn, but just right so u'll LEARN in this class. it's true that the prof is kind of stuck up, unapproachable and unclear, but that's b/c he's an american in Canada...the cultural stamp is apparent on him.
No Comments

The guy is a pompous ****bag!Very unapproachable. Uses big outdated words to sound smart, all it does is scare students cause we don't know what the hell he's talking about. Spends most of the time "warning" people about not talking in class..get over yourself.Maybe it's cause we don't understand?

Tiffany is very childish. He points out students who talk during every class, as well as lectures everyone on how we do not read the course texts. The course is terrible, but he does explain the concepts somewhat well.

pompous and condescending! he is smart, i'll give him that much, but he treats his students like toddlers! he will waste your money and time by giving you lectures at the beginning of every class about not reading enough and not being bright enough. DEFINATELY NOT HOT either.

A bit confusing at times, but really makes you think.  His lectures were interesting, with Simpsons and the Daily Show clips, but they could get a bit dry at times.  Very easy on the eyes and his voice makes you wanna  fall over.

personally i sucked on the first paper, just average, but got better as the semeter went on. he knows what he is talking about, is objective, and likes discussion in class. overall, it is an interesting class, but so darn easy in terms of papers & final.
90% of the profs on this site who get a hot symbol aren't really. He is exception. Fun and easy class.

He tries to get comments-when he does he can't explain what he actually means.He does Phil on gut instinct- which as students-we don't have yet. The TA will make it clear.See them.Forget about Tiffany.Not a bad course tho.Good TAs. Do it-lectures are fun.

very...interesting class.  c'mon, the simpsons and asian films! was fun!  a lot of the ppl that had problems with this class were  used to clear-cut pwr pt. notes and yes/no answers.  definitely not going to get those here.
He's a nice guy...but the course sucks. I could never understand what he was talking about. Don't take this class.
Anyone that consistently incorporates Simpsons clips in lectures is a great prof in my books.
SO cute haha, how old is he?  Well he's funny and interesting.  He makes the course "fun" but yeah he has hard exams and sometimes he's hard to follow.
No Comments
best philosophy prof ever
pretty nice~exms&papers ok lo..
I am willing to differentiate between the teacher and the class. I didn't find Phil-120 particularly interesting, but Evan Tiffany does a good job of conveying that...ha.
If he weren't cute, we would've fallen asleep at lectures. Sounds like he's undergoing puberty. Videos help illustrate key points about the material of the course, yet he's very difficult to follow.
is it legal to show movie clips in class?
evan tiffany is goodlooking, knowledgable, but very tough...his exams are difficult and challenging..but very nice guy, very nice =)
such a cutie
Funny... actually makes the terrible subject fun and interesting
he's cute ^^
He plays clips from Seinfeld and Simpsons to supplement lectures
No Comments
v. smart & funny. incredibly patient, will explain till u get it. luv his class!
No Comments
loves to play movies in class
No Comments
awesome!
Nice course
he moves around too much
his ballroom dancing moves were NOT SEXY
No Comments
A very funny, cute, and good-looking guy.

phil120 is an extremely hard course for me, I even could no understand the materials the prof provided due to my poor english. My papers might be the C- or D level. I thought I would fail this course but I got full marks on the final through simply memorizing all the notes~and Peter is so nice to give me a B~

OMG this was THE BEST course I've taken so far. Dr Horban introduced me to my new love: philosphy! I love his lectures; they're soooo fun and his voice is just awesome. The q's he poses make me think til my head hurts but nonetheless I had a GREAT time!
ok
No Comments
No Comments
Good guy, *hilarious* examples and gets the job done.  Tricky papers and essays though...  Still, he's very approachable during office hours and is eager to help.  Take him if you can

I loved this class! I've never taken Philosophy before and he made it very interesting. It wasn't hard either, you'll do well if you show up and listen in lecture! Owen is a great, enthusiastic professor.
Great Prof! Highly reccomend. Actually cares about his students, and makes material interesting.
Easy course, can watch all of his lectures online. 2 papers and 2 quizzes all based on his lectures, super easy!
